title: spack spec fails due to unsatisfiable dependency
body:
Trying to use #5716 I ran into the problem of getting a concretisation error of one of our internal packages. I also tried it with ```db149876a42ec4cc8db9e488d90d71c7d811a7a6``` where it also fails. So the reason isn't in #5716, although I know that it worked at some point in August.

This is the error message:
```
Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Error: An unsatisfiable variant constraint has been detected for spec:

    pcre@8.40%gcc@4.9.2~jit+utf arch=linux-debian8-x86_64 


while trying to concretize the partial spec:

    git@2.14.1%gcc@4.9.2 arch=linux-debian8-x86_64 


git requires pcre variant +jit, but spec asked for ~jit
```

It fails with current ```develop``` (Time to fail: ~1:30), but doesn't fail when setting the defaults of ```pcre``` to ```+jit```. (Time to complete: ~2:40)
Checking out ```db149876a42ec4cc8db9e488d90d71c7d811a7a6``` (the last commit before the merge) also fails (Time to complete: ~4:50)

will add some strange example code in a couple of minutes
